title: Polanco keeps rolling as M's take two in Toronto

title: Number of births declines; deaths rise slightly: report
content: There were 2.52 crore births in 2023, around 2.32 lakh fewer than in 2022. The Vital Statistics of India based on Civil Registration System (CRS) report for the year 2023 shows 86.6 lakh deaths were registered in 2023, a marginal increase from 86.5 lakh deaths in 2022.

content: Pinarayi says adverse newspaper headlines and accusatory news chyrons on television channels will not deter him from taking the derogatory allegations aimed at causing him political and reputational damage head-on

content: The initial proposal, submitted to the government in 2024, included building elevated corridors covering 110 km, estimated to cost around ‚Çπ13,200 crore, excluding land acquisition

title: Panel to be set up for Polytechnic modernisation
content: The course in Cinematography and Sound Recording & Engineering was originally introduced in 1943 at Sri Jayachamarajendra Government Polytechnic as a result of the foresight of M.Visvesvaraya. In 1996, this course was renamed and relocated to Hesaraghatta, where it was spread across 25 acres, as the Government Film and Television Institute with assistance from the World Bank.

title: Citizen response programme will give Kerala a new sense of direction, says Pinarayi
content: Under the programme, scheduled from January 1 to February 28, 2026, volunteers will reach out to people, listen to their opinions and suggestions and prepare reports which will form the blueprint of Kerala‚Äôs path to progress

content: He suffered a heart attack on Sunday night and passed away at KMC Hospital in Manipal of Udupi district on Monday evening

content: At a press conference, senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad urges the people of Bihar ‚Äònever to be taken in by Tejashwi Yadav‚Äôs promises, because jobs will not be provided and your land will be taken‚Äô

title: Onion glut triggers price crash in Dindigul wholesale market
content: About 10 days ago, the market at Dindigul received 250 tonnes of onion and the price was fixed at ‚Çπ25 a kg. On Monday, a fresh stock of 300 tonnes arrived triggering a crash in price

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis confirmed in two children in Kerala
content: Health officials confirmed that 40 persons are undergoing treatment for amoebic meningoencephalitis in public and private hospitals across the State

title: Minibus hits culvert near Ongole, one dead
content: The police officials rescued 19 occupants of the minibus which  hit a culvert, overturned and fell into a canal

title: Sharjeel Imam seeks two-week bail to contest Bihar election
content: Lodged in Tihar jail for over five years and awaiting trial in a larger conspiracy case related to north-east Delhi Riots 2020, Imam seeks to contest as an Independent candidate from Bahadurganj constituency in his home State.

title: Gaza deal: Trump signs peace plan, hostages exchanged, Israeli troops return ‚Äî what‚Äôs next?
content: A landmark Gaza peace deal, brokered by the US and regional leaders, was signed in Egypt, facilitating a hostage-prisoner exchange. While initial phases saw hostage releases and aid surges, critical issues like Hamas disarmament, postwar governance, and Palestinian statehood remain contentious. The fragile agreement faces significant hurdles for full implementation.

title: Exclusive | Russia, once chess's home, now home-breaker: 'We can't play'
content: Once the heart of global chess, Russia‚Äôs dominance is fading amid geopolitical turmoil and FIDE sanctions. Belarus No. 1 Denis Lazavik reveals the struggles of young players: limited team opportunities, the temptation to switch federations, and the financial and logistical hurdles of competing internationally. Despite these challenges, Lazavik remains focused on climbing the rating ladder and chasing his World Championship dreams.

title: Google VP of Product not happy With Silicon Valley's love for small teams; says they are 'wrong' because‚Ä¶
content: Google VP Robby Stein warns against Silicon Valley's "cult" of lean teams, arguing that underinvestment kills promising products. He emphasizes that foundational AI breakthroughs require scale and patience, and teams should transition from scrappiness to scaling once internal conviction and external user validation are achieved. Stein advocates for building capable teams to create strong product versions, not just the smallest ones.

title: 'India is a great country': Donald Trump lauds 'friend' PM Modi in Gaza peace summit
content: US President Donald Trump praised Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "very good friend" at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit, expressing optimism for improved India-Pakistan relations.  The remarks followed a historic peace agreement for Gaza, with both leaders discussing trade progress and Trump inviting Pakistan's PM to speak.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor‚Äôs WhatsApp plea; suggests Zoho‚Äôs Arattai
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. A doctor's petition seeking restoration of her blocked account was dismissed, with the court suggesting alternative apps like Zoho's Arattai. The ruling emphasizes that users must adhere to platform policies for privately operated services.

title: 'You don‚Äôt mind right?': Trump calls Meloni 'beautiful young woman' in Gaza peace summit
content: At the Gaza Peace Summit, US President Donald Trump complimented Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's appearance, calling her a "beautiful young woman." He then praised her political success and effectiveness.

title: Tech crash: Trump‚Äôs China tariffs causes $770 bn wipeout from Amazon, Nvidia, Tesla
content: Tech giants like Amazon, Nvidia, and Tesla faced a massive $770 billion market value drop following President Trump's threat of 100% tariffs on China and export controls.  This significant market downturn, the worst since April, also impacted the Nasdaq and S&P 500, with Bitcoin experiencing a sharp decline as well.

title: 'Pak thought it could do anything': CDS Chauhan on Operation Sindoor
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan stated India cannot tolerate even the threat of a nuclear attack, citing Operation Sindoor's success in proving Pakistan's nuclear assumptions wrong. He emphasised that nation-building is a collective effort, with the entire country fighting wars, not just the armed forces.

title: Patrick Mahomes boycott rumor: The truth behind viral Bad Bunny post
content: Viral claims that Patrick Mahomes would boycott the 2026 Super Bowl over Bad Bunny's halftime show and join Turning Point USA are false. Mahomes has made no such statements regarding Bad Bunny or the political group. His wife, Brittany, made a general comment about hate after Charlie Kirk's death, but Mahomes himself remains apolitical.

title: Report: Taylor Swift, Blake Lively reunite; Travis Kelce quietly present
content: Whispers suggest Taylor Swift and Blake Lively have rekindled their friendship after months of rumored distance, fueled by Lively's recent lawsuit drama. Swift's new song, 'CANCELLED!', is believed to be a tribute to Lively's public struggles. This potential reunion hints at Swift rebalancing her life amidst her relationship with Travis Kelce and her global tour.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury: Cowboys WR‚Äôs Week 7 status vs Washington uncertain
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver CeeDee Lamb is nearing a potential return in Week 7 after a three-game absence due to a high-ankle sprain. While his status remains uncertain, positive recovery signs are encouraging. Meanwhile, George Pickens has stepped up significantly, becoming a primary offensive threat and keeping the Cowboys' passing game potent.

title: 'You won‚Äôt miss Rohit when Jaiswal opens with Gill': Ex-India cricketer‚Äôs bold claim
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's impressive Test form has led to predictions of him becoming an all-format regular for India. Former opener Aakash Chopra believes Jaiswal could soon open alongside Shubman Gill in ODIs, potentially making fans forget Rohit Sharma. Chopra also anticipates a massive IPL season for Jaiswal and foresees him as India's preferred T20 opener post-2026.

title: Ouch! KL Rahul cries out in pain after ball strikes him on the box ‚Äì Watch
content: Indian opener KL Rahul endured a painful blow to the groin from a 134 kph delivery on Day 4 of the second Test against West Indies. Despite the incident, Rahul showed resilience, remaining unbeaten on 25 as India closed at 63/1, needing just 58 more runs for a series sweep.

title: ‚ÄòThis took 3,000 years': Trump signs Gaza peace deal in Egypt summit
content: US President Donald Trump and regional leaders signed a landmark Gaza peace deal in Egypt, hailed as a historic step toward regional stability. The comprehensive agreement formalizes frameworks for ceasefire implementation, humanitarian assistance, and longer-term peace talks between Israel and Palestinian authorities.  The summit, co-chaired by Trump and Egyptian President El-Sisi, saw participation from numerous world leaders.

title: MLB legend Sandy Alomar Sr. dies at 81, father of Hall of Famer Roberto Alomar and Sandy Jr.
content: Sandy Alomar Sr., a 15-season MLB veteran and 1970 All-Star, has passed away at 81. Known for his speed and defense, Alomar Sr. also had a significant coaching career and was the father of MLB stars Sandy Alomar Jr. and Hall of Famer Roberto Alomar. His extensive contributions to baseball spanned over five decades.

title: Trump pauses speech, asks Pak PM to say 'few words'; Sharif kowtows ceasefire claim
content: US President Donald Trump unexpectedly invited Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to speak at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit on Gaza. Sharif lauded Trump as a "man of peace," praising his efforts in achieving a Gaza ceasefire and previously de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Unexpected drama! Girl slaps boy in stands during IND vs WI Test
content: During the India vs. West Indies Test, an unusual off-field incident saw a girl physically confront a boy in the stands, captured by broadcast cameras and quickly going viral. While the match saw India in a strong position to win, the fan altercation dominated online discussions about crowd behavior.

title: NFL game turns into a love story: Colts cheerleader Mika gets on-field proposal
content: During a thrilling Colts game, cheerleader Mika received an unforgettable surprise as her boyfriend, Spencer, proposed on the field. Amidst thousands of cheering fans and her teammates' support, Mika tearfully accepted, turning a football match into a viral moment of pure joy. The heartwarming proposal, captured on video, has captivated NFL fans nationwide.

title: Cars to fighter planes: Xi's shock & awe gambit - will Trump blink first?
content: China has imposed sweeping export controls on critical materials like rare earths and electric motors, impacting global supply chains from cars to defense systems. This move escalates the trade conflict, prompting US President Trump to threaten further tariffs and export restrictions. The situation highlights a new phase of economic confrontation with significant implications for international trade and security.

title: One thing you shouldn't be surprised by ... for every NBA team
content: if he gets hurt again, we must reevaluate. PF/SF Jayson Tatum is out for much of the season . SG/PG Derrick White will see a career-best in shots .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What final four must do to reach Fall Classic
content: the 2025 league championship series is set for a trip to the world series on the line . the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Milwaukee Brewers will begin their series on a national league side of the bracket .

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: Cape Verde book first finals appearance
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage take place in October, when we will discover the seven nations joining Morocco and Tunisia .

title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .

title: AP Week 7 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the top two teams in the poll stayed steady but there was movement not far below . then-no. 7 Indiana went to then no. 3 Oregon and notched a big win to declare themselves as legitimate national title contenders . Alabama and Ole Miss squeaked out wins . now they are atop the SEC alongside Texas A&M .

title: Power Rankings: Indiana climbs into top 3; four new teams join the Top 25
content: Oklahoma can still make the playoffs even with a loss to Texas . Ohio State allowed a whopping 16 points at Illinois, seven more than it had in any other game this season . the most dominant team is looking for areas to improve as the midpoint of 2025 season arrives .

title: What does Brian Callahan's firing mean for Cam Ward, 1-5 Titans?
content: the Titans hired the former Cincinnati Bengals offensive coordinator in January 2024 . callahan worked with the likes of peyton Manning, Matthew Stafford , Derek Carr and Joe Burrow . he finished with a 3-14 record in his first season with second-year quarterback Will Levis .

title: An NBA dynasty reborn? Why the Warriors could be more dangerous than you think
content: the Golden State Warriors have just the seventh-best odds to win the West this season . they are behind the defending champions Oklahoma City Thunder, Denver Nuggets, Houston Rockets , los Angeles Lakers , Minnesota Timberwolves and LA Clippers . if Buddy Hield joins Stephen Curry , Jimmy Butler III , Draymond Green and Al Horford in the starting lineup .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 at midseason: Buckeyes the team to beat
content: Ohio State has emerged as the clear favorite in "SportsCenter" at the midpoint of the season, Penn State has three losses . Texas is trying to claw its way back into the playoff conversation, and undefeated Indiana is a top five team . the battle for no. 1 is ongoing .

content: police identified the deceased as fire and rescue officer Sony s Kumar (36), a resident of Attingal; archana M (34) at Neduvathoor and Sivakrishna S (23) of Kodungalloor, Thrissur .

title: Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Kapur sent on leave amid IPS officer‚Äôs suicide row
content: Ajay Sura is Senior Assistant Editor with The Times of India Chandigarh. He covers news concerning the State of Haryana, Punjab & Haryana High Court and Defence & Military Affairs. He likes to analyse political developments and decoding judicial pronouncements. His hobbies include travelling, mountaineering and trekking. Read More

title: After Army alert, Baramulla administration bans drones
content: baramulla district administration imposed a complete ban on flying drones in the north Kashmir district until October 31 . intelligence inputs gathered by the army indicated the possible smuggling of unmanned aerial devices (UAVs) into Kashmir Valley and their potential usage against security forces and vital installations .

title: Not a single appeal filed so far against Bihar rolls: Chief electoral officer
content: a single appeal has been filed against the inclusion or exclusion of any person in the final roll . the state chief electoral officer shared in a social media update on monday . if the appellant remains unsatisfied with the district magistrate ruling, he can file a second and final appeal .

title: Supreme Court seeks response of Centre, TN & Kerala on safety audit of Mullaperiyar
content: a bench of CJI B R Gavai and justice K Vinod Chandran sought responses from both states and the centre . the 'Save Kerala Brigade' petition expressed concern over the dam, located in a seismic zone, posing a serious threat to the lives of 10 million people living downstream .

title: Sister of Durgapur rape accused on run helps cops nab him
content: the elder sister of the main accused in the alleged gang rape of a medical student in Durgapur helped police track down her absconding brother and arrest him early Monday . the two arrests are now in custody, police say .

title: Hang them, says dad of BTech grad beaten to death by MP cops
content: a 21-year-old BTech graduate out partying with friends in a car died after alleged thrashing . two constables allegedly turned on the group on the pretext of traffic rule violations . a candle light vigil is held for Udit Gayaki in Bhopal .

title: J&K Rajya Sabha poll spat pushes NC-Congress alliance to brink
content: Congress withdrew from next week's Rajya Sabha elections to four seats from J&K . the governing party nominated its fourth candidate, pushing the INDIA bloc partners to the brink of a split . Congress accuses its partner national conference of denying it a ‚Äúsafe seat‚Äù .

title: Woman from Manipur found dead in Munirka, partner critical
content: the deceased was identified as thempi Khongsai, a beautician by profession . her partner, Thangjam Viney Meitei, is undergoing treatment at AIIMS Trauma Centre . both were originally from manipur and were living together in a rented flat .

title: Forget jobs, you will lose even your land: BJP on Tejashwi promise
content:
NEW DELHI: BJP on Monday asked voters in Bihar to not fall for RJD functionary Tejashwi Yadav's pledge of a government job to every household if his party is elected to office in state, saying they will never get the promised employment but end up losing their land. BJP's Ravi Shankar Prasad mounted a fresh attack on RJD, including its president Lalu Prasad and his wife Rabri Devi, besides Tejashwi, after a special court framed charges against them in a suspected scam in IRCTC when the RJD supremo was railway minister. "It is a historic day, and corruption of RJD's ruling family has been exposed again," he said. In a swipe at Tejashwi, seen as the chief ministerial face of opposition alliance, Prasad said he is going to change Bihar with the charge of Section 420 of IPC (dealing with cheating). "Eating fodder, drinking bitumen, manipulation in award of govt contracts and acquiring land by promising jobs was Lalu's time-tested model of governance," he alleged.

End of Article

title: 3 UP policemen dismissed for kidnap, robbery

title: Karur stampede case has political undertone, says SC, hands it over to CBI
content: the case has "political undertone" a panel is headed by former judge Ajay Rastogi to supervise the investigation . the family of those who died and got injured are in the doldrums and what they want is a free and fair probe .

title: India likely to scrap French Scorpene project, may go for German-origin submarines
content: india may scrap the proposed project to build another three french-origin Scorpene submarines at Mazagon Docks (MDL) the plan for the three additional submarines "is not being pursued now" but the "final decision to scrap it has not yet been taken in black and white," top government sources say .

title: Push US to lift Chabahar curbs, Afghanistan minister urges policymakers
content: amir Khan Muttaqi urges Indian policymakers to push for the removal of US restrictions on the strategic Chabahar port . the foreign minister also announced direct flights between Amritsar and Kabul and tuesday .

title: Probe Kerala man's death, says RSS, denies abuse allegations
content: a 26-year-old software engineer, Anandu Aji, was found dead in a lodge room . the post surfaced soon after his death - a suspected case of suicide . BJP accuses the opposition party of exploiting the tragedy for political mileage .

title: Supreme Court junks plea for probe into 'vote chori' charge, says approach EC
content: the petitioner's counsel told a bench that it is not possible to hold free and fair elections if the electoral rolls are manipulated . the bench of justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi refrained from commenting on the merits of the issue . a practicing advocate in SC had sought a direction to EC .

title: ISI-backed smugglers up game, drones can now detect tracking & scoot back
content:
Based in Punjab with journalistic experience of over two decades, Navjeevan Gopal is a senior journalist reporting on crucial issues such as drugs, crime, gangsters, terror and other security issues in the border state. The Punjab Police is one of his core beats. Currently an assistant editor with The Times of India in Punjab Bureau, he comes with a vast experience of over 18 years in The Indian Express, the national daily known for its investigative journalism. Gopal had started his career in journalism with the Hindustan Times as a contributor, gradually moving to The Indian Express and thereafter TOI. He also covers Punjab‚Äôs politics with his area of interests being the 104-year-old party Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). He also extensively reported on Sikh diaspora settled across the globe.

title: 'One last opportunity': SC slams IITs, IIMs, AIIMS for ignoring suicide survey; orders cooperation
content: around 98 students have taken their lives in premier educational institutes since 2018 . 57,000 institutes including most of the IITs, IIMs, AIIMS and 24 NITs are not cooperating . survey being conducted by apex court-appointed panel to deal with suicides .
